english: great strength; mighty force; with great effort; vigorously

etymology.description: 大 (big; great) + 力 (strength; force) = great strength; vigorously.
etymology.interpretation: Literally “great strength,” used adverbially to mean doing something vigorously or with great effort, and in some contexts as a noun phrase for mighty force. Common in formal policy/announcement language (e.g., 大力推进).

examples.chinese: 我们要大力支持科技创新(我們要大力支持科技創新)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen yào dàlì zhīchí kējì chuàngxīn.
examples.english: We must strongly support scientific and technological innovation.

examples.chinese: 政府正在大力推进绿色能源建设(政府正在大力推進綠色能源建設)。
examples.pinyin: Zhèngfǔ zhèngzài dàlì tuījìn lǜsè néngyuán jiànshè.
examples.english: The government is vigorously advancing the development of green energy.

examples.chinese: 他用大力把门推开了(他用大力把門推開了)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng dàlì bǎ mén tuī kāi le.
examples.english: He used great force to push the door open.
